node.title: Switches behave incorrectly being initially rendered hidden
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
Switches that are within a hidden div display incorrectly when clicked, and cause a JavaScript error when click-dragged.

## Expected behavior
Switch appears and behaves correctly after going from hidden to visible.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-qwyfmb
1. Create a Switch within a hidden div.
2. Change the hidden div to visible.
3. Try to use the Switch.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have forms that are tabbed. Sometimes Switches are initially rendered within a hidden tab, and then displayed to the user.

## Environment
Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) Version 68.0.3440.106 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Firefox version 61.0.2 (64-bit)

System:
- Node version: v8.9.3
- Platform: Windows

node.title: Invisible value axis labels are still "rendered" on the chart
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
Bug Report

## Current behavior
In a kendo chart, if you have a value axis that is invisible, but has a label, the chart renders a gap where that axis would be placed.

## Expected behavior
An invisible axis shouldn't take up any room on the chart surface

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
See: https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-kadcbq-3ezv4y?file=app/main.js

Notice how the "Degrees" axis on the top chart is not lined up with the "Degrees" axis on the bottom chart. If you remove the label from the (invisible) "Percent" axis in the first chart, the charts then render properly aligned.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We build charts dynamically and allow the user to turn an axis on/off at runtime - currently we now have to remove the labels for each invisible axis, instead of simply toggling their visiblitiy.

Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) version 68

node.title: DropDownList valueField property was removed
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Regression report
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
Dropdownlist no longer displays text based on ID on load, and changing the value causes errors in our application. This is due to the valueField property being removed which we were using heavily.

## Expected behavior
valueField or some equivalent being re-implemented.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-s5mclz

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a form which loads data from the database to be edited. We often have 'reference' fields e.g Foreign Keys. We allow our users to change these using a drop down list with the valid options. This has become more difficult since the removal of the valueField option.

It's definitely possible to work around this issue but it seems like a strange choice to remove the property.

## Environment
Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) Version 69.0.3497.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

System:
- Node version: v8.9.3
- NPM version: 6.4.1
- Platform:  Windows

node.title: DropDowns ComboBox : Keyboard Navigation
node.body:
According to the documentation here : [link](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/dropdowns/combobox/keyboard-navigation/)

I'm expecting from the example of the link above to : 
1- Open the _Popup_
2- Select an item, "_Baseball_" for example.
3- Open the _Popup_ again
4- Navigate using **Up and Down Arrows**
5- Hit **ESC**
6- The item "_Baseball_" should be selected, unless I hit **Enter** in step 5.

The documentation stresses that the Up arrow : "_Selects the previous available item._" which is right. The second part is incorrect "_Highlights it only if the popup is open._" I believe it's a bug here and should be fixed.

node.title: Unable to enter fractions starting with .0 in NumericTextBox
node.body:
<!--
  Please help us process GitHub issues faster by providing the necessary information in the template format that follows.
  We might not be able to assist with issues which lack important information.
-->

## I'm submitting a...
<!--
  Please submit:
  * Feature requests to our UserVoice Portal at https://goo.gl/HsVr7R.
  * Support requests to https://www.telerik.com/account/support-tickets.
-->

<!--  Leave one of the following options. -->
* Bug report <!-- Please search for a similar issue before you submit a bug report. -->

## Current behavior
<!--
  * Describe the current (faulty) behavior which is caused by the issue.
  * In the latest package versions, check whether this behavior still represents an issue.
-->
Entering fractions such as '.05' in NumericTextBox results in the value getting set to whole number -> .05 becomes '5'

## Expected behavior
<!-- Describe what the desired behavior would be. -->
The NumericTextBox should allow fractional inputs such as .05 .01 etc. It should not be required to input theses as 0.05, 0.01 etc as users tend to skip the '0.' part in most cases.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
<!--
For bug reports, please provide the **STEPS TO REPRODUCE** and, if possible, a **MINIMAL DEMO** of the issue. You can use https://plnkr.co or share your project in a public repository.

  1. Find an example in [the documentation](http://www.telerik.com/kendo-angular-ui/components/) that looks similar to your case.
  2. Open it in Plunker by using the **OPEN AS PLUNKER** button.
  3. Modify the plunk, so that the issue is reproducible in it. Try to include the minimum possible amount of code.
  4. Save the plunk by using the blue **Save** button at the top.
  5. Copy the link from the address bar of the browser.
-->
Go To:
https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/inputs/numerictextbox/#toc-basic-usage
In the basic usage example, input value .05 in the NumericTextBox input. It shows value as '5' instead of 0.05 or .05.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
<!-- Describe the motivation or the concrete use case. -->
User input is unexpectedly changed to incorrect value that many order of magnitude larger.

## Environment

Package versions:
<!--
  Paste the output from "npm ls --depth 0" in the code block below.
  Omit this step if the problem is reproducible on our demo site.
-->
```
    "@progress/kendo-react-inputs": "2.2.0"
```

Browser:
<!-- Leave only the browsers that you tested the issue with. -->
- Chrome (desktop) version 69.0.3497.100
- Firefox version 61.0.1
- IE version 11.0.9600.19035

System:
- Node version:  v6.11.5, v8.9.1 <!-- run "node --version" and "npm --version"-->

node.title: Docs Typo: Dialog - Keyboard Navigation (Tap vs Tab)
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...

* Documentation issue or request

## Current behavior

The word, `Tab` is misspelled on the page, [Keyboard Navigation](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/dialog/keyboard-navigation/):

>When the Dialog is opened, the initial focus is set on the `Dialog` element. This approach enables the user to immediately select or navigate between the action buttons by using the `Tap` and `Shift`+`Tap` keys, and to close the Dialog with the `Esc` button.
>
>You can set the initial focus to one of the action buttons by using the [`autoFocus`](http://www.jackcallister.com/2014/11/25/autofocus-in-react-js.html) attribute.
>
>| SHORTCUT                            | DESCRIPTION                                        |
>|:---                                 |:---                                                |
>| `Esc`                               | Calls the `onClose` event handler.                 |
>| `Shift`+`Tap`                       | Moves the focus to the previous focusable element. |
>| `Tap`                               | Moves the focus to the next focusable element.     |

## Expected behavior

>When the Dialog is opened, the initial focus is set on the `Dialog` element. This approach enables the user to immediately select or navigate between the action buttons by using the `Tab` and `Shift`+`Tab` keys, and to close the Dialog with the `Esc` button.
>
>You can set the initial focus to one of the action buttons by using the [`autoFocus`](http://www.jackcallister.com/2014/11/25/autofocus-in-react-js.html) attribute.
>
>| SHORTCUT                            | DESCRIPTION                                        |
>|:---                                 |:---                                                |
>| `Esc`                               | Calls the `onClose` event handler.                 |
>| `Shift`+`Tab`                       | Moves the focus to the previous focusable element. |
>| `Tab`                               | Moves the focus to the next focusable element.     |

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions

Not applicable

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?

Fix spelling for documentation

## Environment

Package versions: N/A
Browser: N/A
System: N/A

node.title: Using the "and" operator to render multi-column headers produce false columns.
node.body:
Using the "and" operator to render multi-column headers produce false columns.

This can be observed here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-2b8ek7

We can think of an approach of how to optimize this use case. Currently, the column configuration can be kept in JSON array which will be modified based on the state values.

Any feedback and suggestions are welcomed.

node.title: Ability to render the pager or another Grid component on customization position.
node.body:
Based on a couple of requests about rendering the Grid pager at the top.

We have a couple of solutions which we need to evaluate:

1) Expose a Pager component - This will allow the user to place the pager at the desired place.
2) Have a setting for the pager - bottom, top and both. The issue here is where to place the pager, on the top of the Grid over the toolbar, the grouping header or below them.
3) Exposing a render prop for the Grid which will allow customizing the Grid elements, their order and it will allow cloning them and placing them on the desired place.

node.title: DatePicker & TimePicker - Manual keyboard input issue.
node.body:
<!--
  Please help us process GitHub issues faster by providing the necessary information in the template format that follows.
  We might not be able to assist with issues which lack important information.
-->

## I'm submitting a...
<!--
  Please submit:
  * Feature requests to our UserVoice Portal at https://goo.gl/HsVr7R.
  * Support requests to https://www.telerik.com/account/support-tickets.
-->

<!--  Leave one of the following options. -->
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
<!--
  * Describe the current (faulty) behavior which is caused by the issue.
  * In the latest package versions, check whether this behavior still represents an issue.
-->
Using the demo from the documentation, once a time is set, it becomes difficult to change the hour or minute via the keyboard (using the keypad).  The arrow keys work flawlessly, but as an example, if we have 10:30 freshly set via the set button (in its drop-down), I can type two keystrokes and it'll keep.  However, once set by the keystrokes, if I return focus on the minute and type two new digits/keystrokes, it only accepts the first digit/keystroke and loses focus.

## Expected behavior
<!-- Describe what the desired behavior would be. -->
Allow two digit keystrokes to be accepted and retained before losing focus or advancing to the next option.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
<!--
For bug reports, please provide the **STEPS TO REPRODUCE** and, if possible, a **MINIMAL DEMO** of the issue. You can use https://plnkr.co or share your project in a public repository.

node.title: NumericTextBox currency format is cumbersome to edit
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
Deleting the existing value to type a new one doesn't behave as expected. It replaces the values with 0 instead of allowing space for new numbers.

## Expected behavior
Pressing backspace or delete in the text box should delete the value. Formatting and validation should be applied on blur instead of on change.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-6tetzy

**NumericTextBox:**
1. Try to change the cents from 53 to 10 by pressing backspace. The cents becomes 00, and then it will add 10 to the start of the 00 making it $101.1000 which doesn't make sense.
2. Try to change the entire value to $95 flat by pressing backspace to remove the existing value. The total value becomes $0.00, and 95 will be added to the start making it $950. If you press backspace all the way to the $ sign it replaces the first digit with 9, but this is counter to user expectation for textboxes.

**Standard HTML input:**
1. Try to change the cents from 53 to 10 by pressing backspace. The cents will be cleared and the new value can be entered normally.
2. Try to change the entire value to $95 flat by pressing backspace to remove the existing value. The total value will be cleared and become blank, and the new value can be added normally.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a lot of money type textboxes in our app, which are adjusted and edited frequently. It's also an international app and we really like Kendo UI's globalisation features and would like to use them but the Numeric Text Box is a bit difficult to use on a frequent basis.

Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) version 70.0.3538.77 (Official Build) (64-bit)

System:
- Platform: Windows

node.title: IE11 clicking on Multiselect does not always open dropdown list
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
In Internet Explorer 11. Click inside the multiselect. The list drops down. Click the multiselect again. The list closes. Click the multiselect again. The list does not open. You must click towards the middle or right hand side of the component.
Keep clicking the multiselect over and over and you will see the list does not open all the time.

(If you click elsewhere on the screen first, and then back to the multiselect again, it will display the list items correctly. Or if you click the multi select multiple times it will display the list correctly)

A summary is: When clicking on the k-multiselect-wrap while the k-input is already focussed, the dropdown list does not toggle. 

## Expected behavior
When clicking the Multiselect it should open the list. When clicking it again it should close the list. Then when clicking it again it should open the list again.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
Step 1. Use Internet Explorer 11.
Step 2 Click the Multi Select. The list drops down.
Step 3. Click the Multi Select again, or Select an Item. The list closes.
Step 4. Click the Multi Select again one time. The list does not open.
NB! You must click towards the middle or right hand side of the component. 
If you click close to the left, or close to any existing tags it will work fine

This is the same as the demo site demo:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-uydchp?file=package.json

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
Whenever a user selects a Multi Select item, they experience buggy behavior, having to click the multiselect multiple times

## Environment
Same as demo site


Browser:
- IE version 11

System:
- Platform:  Windows

## Current behavior
When using columnMenu as described [here](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/columns/column-menu/) for React it works providing the columns are not passed via props.children.

As we want to encapsulate a lot of functionality within the grid, I have a grid component (which has filtering, grouping etc functionality), and from an implementation point of view we use this component and pass in our column names. The grid component will then render these columns using `{props.children}`. However, specifying a columnMenu on the columns results in the error:

node.body:
## I'm submitting a...

* Bug report

## Current behavior

kendo-react-dropdowns does not work with create-react-app when using typescript.

> node_modules/@progress/kendo-react-dropdowns/dist/npm/common/settings.d.ts
>  Type error: Ambient const enums are not allowed when the '--isolatedModules' flag is provided.  TS1209

## Expected behavior

Using `<DropDownList>` should not cause an error.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions

```
npx create-react-app foo
cd foo
```

Now follow the guide here to enable typescript:

https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/adding-typescript

Note the comment at the end of the documentation:

> Note: Constant enums and namespaces are not supported.

Now attempt to use kendo-react-dropdowns:

```
npm install @progress/kendo-react-dropdowns
```

...

```
import {DropDownList} from "@progress/kendo-react-dropdowns";
```

Gives:

```
node_modules/@progress/kendo-react-dropdowns/dist/npm/common/settings.d.ts
Type error: Ambient const enums are not allowed when the '--isolatedModules' flag is provided.  TS1209

     98 |  * @hidden
     99 |  */
  > 100 | export declare const enum ActiveDescendant {
        |                           ^
    101 |     'PopupList' = 0,
    102 |     'TagsList' = 1
    103 | }
```

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?

react-create-app is the standard way of create react applications, and have selected the babel typescript integration as the 'blessed' way of using typescript.

Certainly, the typescript standard supports this feature, but `DropDownList` is a fundamental component; this is a show-stopper for using kendo-react.

node.title: Expose TimePicker setValue function
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
<!--  Leave one of the following options. -->
* Suggestion for improvement

## Current behavior
There is no official way to manually update the TimePicker for uncontrolled components.

## Expected behavior
Either one of these options would be wonderful:

TimePicker.setValue(date);
TimePicker.value = date;

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-zphqrv?file=app/main.js
You can see in the HandleChange function, we're forced to use .setState({ value: value }) directly, which may be bypassing some internal logic we aren't aware of in the TimePicker component.

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a form with a lot of TimePicker components in the style of:

Monday: {TimePicker Start Time} {TimePicker End Time}
Tuesday: {TimePicker Start Time} {TimePicker End Time}
...

If the user chooses an invalid time e.g a Start time that is after the End time, we would like to allow the change but update the end time to match the start time for ease of use. This is currently a difficult operation.

Using controlled inputs with value={} causes performance issues as the entire page is re-rendered on keystroke so we would prefer to continue using defaultValue={}.

## Environment
Browser:
- Chrome (desktop) version 70.0.3538.110 (Official Build) (64-bit)

System:
- Node version: v8.9.3 6.4.1
- Platform:  Windows

node.title: Passing array with single ExcelExportColumn as Children results in error
node.body:
At this line:
```jsx
const root = React.Children.count(this.props.children) === 1 && React.Children.only(this.props.children);
```
`count` returns 1, but `children` is array, and `only` throws exception. 

Workaround: map the columns to `columns` prop instead of `children` prop.

sample: https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-2b8ek7-qhbqgb?file=app/main.js

node.title: kendo-draggable - Type error: 'bindTo', which lacks return-type annotation, implicitly has an 'any' return type. (Typescript Typings issue)
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report 

## Current behavior
.../ClientApp/node_modules/@telerik/kendo-draggable/dist/npm/main.d.ts
Type error: 'bindTo', which lacks return-type annotation, implicitly has an 'any' return type.  TS7010

line | code
-- | --
8 | export default class Draggable {
9 |     constructor(options?: DraggableOptions)
10 |     bindTo(element: Element)
error     |     ^
11 |     destroy()
12 | }
13 |

## Easy Fix
I just added ": void" return-type declarations to both bindTo() and destroy() in my local copies and it compiled and ran fine.
```
export default class Draggable {
    constructor(options?: DraggableOptions)
    bindTo(element: Element): void
    destroy(): void
}
```

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
In a Create-React-App 2.1+ Typescript project just import kendo-react-dialogs in a tsx page. Don't even have to use it.
```
import { Dialog, DialogActionsBar } from '@progress/kendo-react-dialogs';
```

Package versions:

## Current behavior

When the item is selected in MultiSelect, a list with items closes and you have to open it again to select another one. You do not have the option to disable that behaviour.

## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
ColumnMenu Dropdown that near the rightmost edge of the browser will enable horizontal scrollbar and stick to the edge if user scrolls. This happens when `body` has `overflow: scroll`.
![screen shot 2019-01-29 at 11 53 11 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28632395/51936265-a6c0fc80-23bc-11e9-9f5b-93126c7f023d.png)
![screen shot 2019-01-29 at 11 53 22 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28632395/51936285-ade80a80-23bc-11e9-8b00-e5bfc46f3e8f.png)

## Expected behavior
ColumnMenu dropdown should stay at the place and not trigger horizontal scrollbar. 

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions

1. [Link](https://react-kz9ans.stackblitz.io/) to reproduction of issue
If you cannot open it, go to [here](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/columns/column-menu/ ) and open the first example code in stackblitz

2. Add `overflow: scroll` to `body`

3.  Expand the rightmost columnMenu dropdown, and try to scroll right.

## Environment

Package versions:
Reproducible on [here](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/columns/column-menu/)

Browser:
<!-- Leave only the browsers that you tested the issue with. -->
- Chrome (desktop)  71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)

System:
- Platform:  Windows

This issue only reproducible on Windows machines by far, I can't reproduce it on Mac. Maybe Mac and Windows handle scrollbar differently.

node.title: Grid details row action header
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...

* Bug report

## Current behavior
If you go [here](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/advanced-features/detail/) you'll see that there is a header element on the left of the Product header. This header space was not present in previous versions of Kendo.

## Expected behavior
This header should not be visible like in previous versions.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
In official documentation [here](https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/advanced-features/detail/) 

We do not have a way to remove that header if we want to have details row.

node.title: DatePicker Doesn't Focus Correctly On iPad
node.body:
## I'm submitting a...
* Bug report

## Current behavior
'Tabbing' to the DatePicker on iPad Safari places the cursor at the end of the field.

## Expected behavior
It should place the cursor at the start (in this case the Day field) so typing the date flows logically.

## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
Editor URL:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-fzcstv

Viewer URL:
https://react-fzcstv.stackblitz.io

1. Tap into the empty example textbox to focus it.
2. Press the 'next field' button on the keyboard (functions like pressing Tab) to navigate to the DatePicker.
3. The cursor will be placed at the end, and typing will type into Year. It is impossible from this point to type into Day or Month without carefully tapping the section on the screen.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12272970/52030319-2e4a6f00-2567-11e9-86dc-3fa7d77985c0.png)

## What is the motivation or use case for changing the behavior?
We have a DatePicker as part of a form. When tabbing to focus the DatePicker, users started typing the Day field without noticing it focused incorrectly, causing extra clicks and frustration.

Browser:
- Safari (iOS) version 12.1.1
